channel.title: [PI] Run error (317)
channel.description:
Forgot :palm: :confused: /: [CODE] Exception in thread "main" java.lang.Error: Unresolved compilation problems: IoAcceptor cannot be resolved to a type SocketAcceptor cannot be resolved to a type SocketAcceptorConfig cannot be resolved to a type SocketAcceptorConfig cannot be resolved to a type IoAcceptor cannot be resolved to a type IoAcceptor cannot be resolved to a type
at server.Server.main(Server.java:158) [/CODE] Any and every help is greatly appreciated. Thanks!

item.title: [PI] Run error (317)
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:15, topic:552190”]for future reference use github gist for single files, it still allows editing and stuff like that

ps you need to import that class, find out where “JoinDate.java” is and post the full directory
i.e. c:/…/…/a/b/c/JoinDate.java[/quote]
Thanks for your reply. I already located the problem and fixed it all

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Run error (317)
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

[quote=“HairyNips, post:13, topic:552190”]package server.content does not exist
You imported a class or directory that doesn’t exist, you should check that.

error: cannot find symbol private JoinDate join = new JoinDate(this);//Join date.

As for these, you missed an import, or you’re missing a method. Were you following a tutorial?[/quote]
Thanks for your reply.
No, I was not following any tutorial, I just got this server, it’s a new base/client i’m trying to work on
Any ideas what it could be??

EDIT: I fixed one of the errors; import server.content.*;
Now, I have 3 more errors showing up, i’m looking into it now!

[CODE]
src\server\model\players\Client.java:534: error: cannot find symbol
private JoinDate join = new JoinDate(this);//Join date.
^
symbol: class JoinDate
location: class Client
src\server\model\players\Client.java:643: error: cannot find symbol
public JoinDate getJoinDate() {
^
symbol: class JoinDate
location: class Client
src\server\model\players\Client.java:534: error: cannot find symbol
private JoinDate join = new JoinDate(this);//Join date.
^
symbol: class JoinDate
location: class Client
Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
3 errors

–Exo-PK V4 Has Completely Finished its Compiling!–

Press any key to continue . . .
[/CODE]

EDITEDIT: I fixed it! Thanks anyways guys! I fixed it

[CODE]
Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.

–Exo-PK V4 Has Completely Finished its Compiling!–

Press any key to continue . . .
[/CODE]

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Run error (317)
item.dc:creator: @HairyNips HairyNips
item.description:
@HairyNips wrote:

package server.content does not exist
You imported a class or directory that doesn’t exist, you should check that.

error: cannot find symbol private JoinDate join = new JoinDate(this);//Join date.

As for these, you missed an import, or you’re missing a method. Were you following a tutorial?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Run error (317)
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:11, topic:552190”][quote author=malimt link=topic=671107.msg4487843#msg4487843 date=1435401502]

I’m actually going to need to see the entire class…
The code provided is cut in such a way I can’t determine whether or not the brackets should be there.

I hope this works for you: https://github.com/mamalimt/Commands.java/issues/1
If not, I have uploaded the file for you, I can provide you with the link.
Thanks.|

EDIT: Here’s the link to DL the file if needed: https://mega.co.nz/#!idglXSiI!tv_UfVCCnTJDgpPmLqoHX897OBG9tMEWtk94fUmMZLU
[/quote]
Had to use the dl link… the one on github had some bad formatting…

I believe this should be fixed… There were no bracket errors shown, but that doesn’t say anything about logic errors.
http://pastebin.com/KwJGqGUm

Here’s how I did it:

  1. Open the file on this site: http://codebeautify.org/javaviewer
  2. Click the beautify button.
  3. Copy the beautified code into an editor like notepad++.
  4. Scroll down until you see a change in the tabbing (Typically, you’ll see some brackets end early and then the next if statements/methods start on beggining of the line, and not one tab over like it should be because it’s within the class).
  5. Fix the code above that.
  6. Repeat if needed.[/quote]
    Thank you very much.
    That really fixed the bracket problems!
    Thank you for also explaining to me how to do it.
    I have 4 errors, but i’m sure I can look into it and fix it in (Client.java)
    Errors:

[CODE]
src\server\model\players\Client.java:40: error: package server.content does not
exist
import server.content.*;
^
src\server\model\players\Client.java:535: error: cannot find symbol
private JoinDate join = new JoinDate(this);//Join date.
^
symbol: class JoinDate
location: class Client
src\server\model\players\Client.java:644: error: cannot find symbol
public JoinDate getJoinDate() {
^
symbol: class JoinDate
location: class Client
src\server\model\players\Client.java:535: error: cannot find symbol
private JoinDate join = new JoinDate(this);//Join date.
^
symbol: class JoinDate
location: class Client
Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
4 errors

–Exo-PK V4 Has Completely Finished its Compiling!–

Press any key to continue . . .
[/CODE]

EDIT: I was trying to fix my errors on eclipse, but for some reason I can’t /: ??
Eclipse has no suggestions?? Even though it’s recognizing it as a error?? I’m so confused lol.
I wonder what kind of errors they are /:

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Run error (317)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“malimt, post:10, topic:552190”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=671107.msg4487842#msg4487842 date=1435401048]
I’m actually going to need to see the entire class…
The code provided is cut in such a way I can’t determine whether or not the brackets should be there.
[/quote]
I hope this works for you: https://github.com/mamalimt/Commands.java/issues/1
If not, I have uploaded the file for you, I can provide you with the link.
Thanks.|

EDIT: Here’s the link to DL the file if needed: https://mega.co.nz/#!idglXSiI!tv_UfVCCnTJDgpPmLqoHX897OBG9tMEWtk94fUmMZLU[/quote]
Had to use the dl link… the one on github had some bad formatting…

I believe this should be fixed… There were no bracket errors shown, but that doesn’t say anything about logic errors.
http://pastebin.com/KwJGqGUm

Here’s how I did it:

  1. Open the file on this site: http://codebeautify.org/javaviewer
  2. Click the beautify button.
  3. Copy the beautified code into an editor like notepad++.
  4. Scroll down until you see a change in the tabbing (Typically, you’ll see some brackets end early and then the next if statements/methods start on beggining of the line, and not one tab over like it should be because it’s within the class).
  5. Fix the code above that.
  6. Repeat if needed.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Run error (317)
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:7, topic:552190”][quote author=malimt link=topic=671107.msg4487836#msg4487836 date=1435399530]

The 100 errors error is 9/10 a missing bracket.
Post your code and I can show you a quick method I use to find the error.

Missing bracket? Maybe that’s most likely right, but I don’t think I’d be able to find it.
What code did you want me to post?
Sorry, I am just a little bit confused with the whole thing.

[/quote]
Missing Bracket means you’re missing this: { or this }.
The code I need to see would be the code displaying your error. In this case, Commands.java[/quote]
I know what a missing bracket is, that question mark was meant to be a exclamation point
Thanks for the quick reply! Here’s the code:

[CODE]
int muteTimer = 86400 * 1000;
for (int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
if (PlayerHandler.players[i] != null) {
if (PlayerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToMute)) {
Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i];
c2.sendMessage(“You have been muted by: “+ c.playerName + " for 1 day”);
c2.muteEnd = System.currentTimeMillis()+ muteTimer;
break;
}
}
}
} catch (Exception e) {
c.sendMessage(“Player must ve offline”);
}
}
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“weekmute”)) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(” ");
if (args.length < 1) {
c.sendMessage(“Currect usage: ::weekmute playername”);
return;
}
String playerToMute = args[1];
int muteTimer = 604800 * 1000;
for (int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
if (PlayerHandler.players[i] != null) {
if (PlayerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToMute)) {
Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i];
c2.sendMessage("You have been muted by: “+ c.playerName + " for 7 day”);
c2.muteEnd = System.currentTimeMillis()+ muteTimer;
break;
}
}
}
} catch (Exception e) {
c.sendMessage(“Player must ve offline”);
}
}

if (playerCommand.startsWith("timedban") && c.playerRights >= 1 && c.playerRights <= 3) { // use as ::ban name

				try {  
                            String[] args = playerCommand.split("-");
                            if(args.length < 2) {
                                
                                c.sendMessage("Correct usage: ::ban-playername-time");
                                return;
                                 
                            }
                             
                            String playerToBan = args[1];
                            int secondsToBan = Integer.parseInt(args[2])*1000;
            
    for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
        if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) {
            if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) {
                                                        Player o = Server.playerHandler.players[i];
                                                        o.banStart = System.currentTimeMillis();
                                                        o.banEnd = System.currentTimeMillis()+ secondsToBan;
                                                        o.disconnected = true;
		      						Connection.addNameToBanList(playerToBan);
								Connection.addNameToFile(playerToBan);
																			break;
						}
					}
				}
     
				c.sendMessage("You banned the player: "+playerToBan+" for "+secondsToBan/1000+" seconds");     
			} catch(Exception e) {
				c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline.");
			}
		}
			if (playerCommand.startsWith("mypks")) {
    c.sendMessage("You have currently "+c.pkPoints+" Pk Points!");

}
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“pkring”) && c.pkPoints > 200) {
c.pkPoints -= 200;
c.getItems().addItem(6583, 1);
c.sendMessage("@red@You have spended 200 Pk Points for a Pk Ring!");
c.sendMessage("@blu@Now you have " +c.pkPoints+ " Pk Points!");
} else {
//c.sendMessage(“You must not have a high enough KS to have one of the rewards”);
}
if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“redskull”) && c.playerTitle > 16) {
c.getPA().requestUpdates();
c.playerLevel[0] = 150;
c.getPA().refreshSkill(0);
c.playerLevel[1] = 150;
c.getPA().refreshSkill(1);
c.playerLevel[2] = 150;
c.getPA().refreshSkill(2);
c.playerLevel[4] = 126;
c.getPA().refreshSkill(4);
c.playerLevel[5] = 5337;
c.getPA().refreshSkill(5);
c.playerLevel[6] = 146;
c.getPA().refreshSkill(6);
c.isSkulled = false;
c.skullTimer = Config.SKULL_TIMER;
c.headIconPk = 1;
c.sendMessage(“You apply your red skull, are you ready to merk?”);

                                            }	
if (playerCommand.startsWith("kick") && playerCommand.charAt(4) == ' ') {
			try {	
				String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(5);
				for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
					if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) {
						if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) {
							Server.playerHandler.players[i].disconnected = true;
						} 
					}
				}
			} catch(Exception e) {
				c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline.");
			}
		}
		}	
		
public void moderatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) 
{			
				if (playerCommand.startsWith("checkbank")) {
						if(c.InDung()) {
								c.sendMessage("<shad=15695415>DO NOT ABUSE</col>, You can not checkbanks when inside Dungeoneering");
						return;
						}    
											String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ", 2);
							for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++)
							{
								Client o = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[i];
								if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null)
								{
									if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(args[1]))
									{
													c.getPA().otherBank(c, o);
									break;
									}
								}
							}
						}

[/CODE]
